job.title: Full-Stack Developer (34085)
job.description:
We are seeking a Full Stack Developer with strong expertise in Angular, Java/Spring Boot, and cloud-native development to join a purpose-driven organization. In this role, you’ll contribute to the design, development, and deployment of secure, scalable, and resilient web applications and backend services used across Canada.
Key Responsibilities:
  • Develop, test, and maintain modern web applications using the Angular framework.
  • Design and implement RESTful services using Java and Spring Boot.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams including DevOps, QA, and business stakeholders to deliver high-quality solutions aligned with organizational goals.
  • Build and deploy applications to cloud environments using Azure AKS, OpenShift, or Kubernetes.
  • Create and manage Helm charts for Kubernetes-based deployments.
  • Work with relational databases such as Oracle, PostgreSQL, or SQL Server to support application data needs.
  • Ensure code quality and maintainability through automated testing, peer reviews, and adherence to development best practices.
  • Contribute to architectural decisions and provide technical guidance on cloud-native strategies and DevOps integration.
Qualifications:
  • 5+ years of experience as a Full Stack Developer or Software Engineer.
  • Proficiency with Angular (v10+), TypeScript, and front-end best practices.
  • Strong backend development experience with Java, Spring Boot, and RESTful API design.
  • Hands-on experience with container orchestration platforms such as Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS), OpenShift, or vanilla Kubernetes.
  • Experience deploying applications using Helm and working in CI/CD environments.
  • Solid understanding of relational databases (e.g., Oracle, PostgreSQL, SQL Server) and writing performant SQL queries.
  • Familiarity with security, compliance, and performance requirements in regulated or healthcare environments is a strong asset.
  • Excellent communication skills and the ability to thrive in a collaborative, mission-focused team environment.

job.title: Cloud Site Reliability Engineer - Azure/AWS (34084)
job.description:
Cloud Site Reliability Engineer – AWS & Azure


Responsibilities

  • Oversee the design and improvement of infrastructure using SRE best practices, including IaC, recovery automation, and systems that detect and resolve issues independently.
  • Manage and fine-tune critical services across both cloud and on-prem environments: Kubernetes clusters, CI/CD pipelines, artifact registries, and custom workloads.
  • Enhance observability through intelligent logging, metrics, tracing, and alerting. Ensuring systems are transparent and actionable in real time.
  • Champion automation by eliminating repetitive tasks, from deployment workflows to security audits, through scripting and tooling.
  • Elevate the developer experience for 80+ engineers and researchers by streamlining secure, reliable workflows across hybrid and cloud-native platforms.
  • Take ownership of IAM governance across platforms like Azure AD and AWS IAM. Implement lifecycle automation, auditing, and access controls.
  • Foster a culture of operational excellence with strong practices around security, incident management, and resilience engineering.
  • Act as a trusted partner to developers and researchers, enabling their speed and innovation without compromising stability.


Experience

  • Experience in Site Reliability Engineering, DevOps, or Systems Engineering within fast-paced, technically demanding environments.
  • Strong background in Linux systems and cloud infrastructure, with hands-on experience in AWS (primary) and Azure environments.
  • Solid command of Kubernetes and container orchestration in production environments.
  • Expertise in Infrastructure as Code tools such as Ansible, building reproducible, scalable infrastructure is second nature to you.
  • Deep experience in observability and incident response: you know how to set up effective monitoring, handle incidents, and lead blameless post-mortems.
  • A security-first mindset, especially when it comes to protecting distributed systems and developer workflows.
  • Proven ability to support and optimize CI/CD pipelines, container image builds, and artifact lifecycle management.
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills. You build trust across teams and advocate for thoughtful, scalable solutions.
  • Bonus if you’ve worked with event-driven architectures using technologies like Kafka.

job.title: Internal Audit Consultant – Banking Sector (34083)
job.description:
Our client is seeking three experienced Internal Audit Consultants to support the execution of a high-impact internal audit within the banking sector. The ideal candidates will bring strong expertise in internal audit practices, with a background in banking. Familiarity with Derivatives, Capital Market products, or Counterparty Credit Risk is considered a strong asset.

Responsibilities:

  • Lead and support internal audit planning and execution

  • Conduct walkthrough meetings with business stakeholders

  • Perform control testing and validate audit evidence

  • Draft internal audit reports with observations and actionable recommendations

  • Collaborate with audit teams to ensure accurate and timely delivery

Required Skills & Experience:

  • 5+ years of Internal Audit and banking experience (mandatory)

  • Strong knowledge of financial controls, audit methodology, and risk management

  • Familiarity with Derivatives, Capital Markets, or Credit Risk (nice to have)

  • Excellent analytical, communication, and reporting skills

Rank: Senior Consultant

Work Model: Hybrid – Toronto-based, 2–3 days onsite per week preferred

job.title: Legal Analyst/Attorney (34082)
job.description:
Myticas's direct client, based in Minneapolis, MN, is seeking a Legal Analyst/Attorney with J.D. for a hybrid contract position.

Job Title: Legal Analyst/Attorney with J.D.
Work Location: Hybrid, 2 days onsite/week at either of locations - St. Cloud, MN or Minneapolis MN

Duration: 6+ month contract-to-Hire


NOTE: MUST HAVE,
  1. Juris Doctor (J.D.) degree.
  2. Ability to review documents.

JOB SUMMARY:
The Legal Invoice Analyst for client, Fulfilment Center of Excellence will be responsible for performing the quality assurance testing for the Legal Bill Analysis Center of Excellence (LBACOE).
  • Understanding of legal terminology and claims legal situations, multijurisdictional exposure preferred.
  • Using sound discretion and legal expertise, analyze and condense legal service agreements to produce effective operational outputs meeting and in some cases exceeding customer expectations.

job.title: Java Developer (34081)
job.description:
Job Title: Programmer Analyst 6-Java Developer
Location: Lansing, MI 48933 (Hybrid- in office 2 days a week Tue/Wed)
Client: Myticas' Direct Client
Candidate Requirement: Local candidates only (within a 2 hour radius of Lansing, MI). No remote-only option available.


Top Skills & Years of Experience:
Core Java Expertise:

  • 7+ years programming complex systems in Java using Eclipse/JBoss Developer Studio
  • 4+ years with Java 8 features and functionality
Framework Experience:
  • 5+ years developing with Spring Framework
  • 5+ years using JPA/Hibernate ORM
Development Practices:
  • 5+ years working in Agile development environments

Job Summary:
This is a java developer position. The position will be supporting the Michigan Department of Transportation's (MDOT) Project Development and Maintenance programs.

As a software developer, the responsibilities include, but are not limited to, working with the project manager, application owner, and resource manager, working on an agile development team to organize work, develop, test, and deploy code. This position performs a variety of complicated tasks and may report directly to a project lead or manager. This position must have excellent communication and teamwork skills, be self-directed, committed, and a quick learner.

In addition to full-stack development, this position will also work with UI/UX team members in building user interfaces and responsive applications.

Required Skills/Experience:
Core Java Development:
  • 7+ years developing complex Java systems using Eclipse/JBoss Developer Studio
  • 4+ years hands-on experience with Java 8
Enterprise Frameworks:
  • 5+ years working with Spring Framework
  • 5+ years experience with JPA/Hibernate
  • 4+ years experience with Oracle 12C/19C databases
Web Development:
  • 4+ years experience with jQuery and jQuery UI
Development Practices:
  • 5+ years working in Agile development environments


Preferred Skills:
Additional Technologies:
  • 4+ years experience with React.js (Desired)
  • 4+ years in JBOSS Enterprise environment (Desired)
  • 4+ years with SQL/PL/SQL (Desired)
Development Tools:
  • 4+ years experience with Log4j, JUnit, and Tiles (Desired)
Reporting:
  • 4+ years with Jasper Reports, Crystal Reports, or Business Objects (Desired)

job.title: Employment Equity Resource - Federal Job Evaluation & Pay Equity Compliance (34080)
job.description:
Our client, a leading federal agency, is seeking an Employment Equity Resource to support a new project related to federal job evaluation and pay equity compliance. This is a confirmed contract win and we are looking to move quickly to identify a qualified consultant. Must have Enhanced Security clearance in place. On-Site.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop and support job evaluation plans and frameworks to ensure compliance with Federal Pay Equity legislation

  • Collaborate with pay equity committees and union members to facilitate job evaluation and classification discussions

  • Conduct advanced data analysis on compensation and job structure data

  • Create clear and concise reports and presentations for internal and external stakeholders

Required Skills & Experience:

  • Experience supporting federal pay equity compliance and job evaluation projects

  • Familiarity working with pay equity committees and/or union groups

  • Strong analytical skills, with a mix of qualitative and quantitative analysis

  • Proficient in Microsoft Excel (advanced formulas, functions, and interconnected worksheets)

  • Experienced in analyzing large, complex data sets

  • Ability to develop polished presentations using Microsoft PowerPoint

Nice to Have:

  • Previous work within federal government job classification systems

  • Bilingual (English/French)

job.title: Data Warehoust Sr. Business Analyst (34075)
job.description:
Clover Consulting (a Myticas Co.) has a direct client in Springfield, IL in need of a Data Warehouse BA for a REMOTE, long-term contract. Travel to Springfield may be required 2-4 times/year. Qualified candidates please provide resume.

Functional Description:
We are seeking a highly motivated Senior Business Analyst to support a large-scale Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) project. This role will serve as a critical liaison between business stakeholders and technical teams, ensuring that data warehouse solutions align with business goals. This role involves gathering and translating business requirements into functional specifications, supporting data modeling efforts, and facilitating testing and validation of data warehouse deliverables.

Primary Responsibilities
  • Collaborate with business users, data engineers, and BI developers to define and document business and data requirements.
  • Analyze existing data sources and business processes to identify gaps and opportunities for improvement.
  • Translate business needs into detailed functional and technical specifications for data warehouse development.
  • Support the design and implementation of ETL processes, interfaces, data marts, reports, and data analytics.
  • Work with our testing team to develop and execute test plans to validate data accuracy and integrity.
  • Facilitate user acceptance testing (UAT) and ensure stakeholder sign-off.
  • Create and maintain documentation including data dictionaries, process flows, and reporting specifications.
  • Act as a subject matter expert on data warehouse capabilities and best practices.
  • Support change management and training efforts related to new data solutions.
Required Qualifications:
  • Bachelor’s degree or higher degree in business intelligence, analytics, computer science, engineering, or related STEM field.
  • 5+ years of healthcare business analysis experience supporting business initiatives through data analysis, writing business requirements and supporting testing of various systems.
  • Good understanding of Fee for Service (FFS), Managed Care claim adjudication processes from eligibility and enrollment to claims processing to funding/finance.
  • Experience working on a Medicaid Enterprise System (MES)/MMIS, or EDW DDI or equivalent.
  • Proficient in MS Word, MS Excel, MS Project, SharePoint, Teams, and MS PowerPoint.
  • Be a self-starter and able to thrive in an environment with little guidance.
  • Excellent interpersonal, oral, and written communication skills.
  • Ability to effectively communicate findings clearly and concisely in writing and verbally to both technical and non-technical audiences
  • Ability to work in a challenging environment with multiple teams and competing priorities
  • Experience with facilitating meetings.
  • Effective organizational, analytical, time management, problem-solving, and multi-tasking skills
  • Ability to complete assignments under tight deadlines with little/no direct supervision.

job.title: Salesforce Developer (32666)
job.description:
Job Title: Programmer Analyst 3 – Salesforce Developer
Location: Lansing, MI 48933 (Hybrid – Onsite 2 Days/Week)
Client: Myticas' Direct Client
Work Schedule: Hybrid (Onsite two days per week from day one)
Candidate Requirement: Local candidates only (within a one-hour radius of Lansing, MI). No remote-only option available.

Top Required Experience/Skills

  • Minimum 5 years of development and testing experience using Salesforce Apex in an enterprise software architecture environment

  • At least 1 year of hands-on API integration experience

  • Proven experience with Salesforce configuration and customizations using Apex, Visualforce, Triggers, Scheduled and Batch classes

  • Familiarity with the Product Development Lifecycle and DevOps tools such as Git, Jenkins, and Azure DevOps

Job Summary

We are seeking an experienced and highly skilled Salesforce Developer to join our team. The ideal candidate will possess extensive experience developing and testing solutions using Salesforce Apex within an enterprise environment. This role requires at least one year of hands-on API integration experience.

You will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing robust Salesforce solutions across a range of platforms including Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, Marketing Cloud, and Salesforce Communities/Knowledge. Candidates should have strong hands-on experience with Salesforce customization and configuration using Apex, Visualforce, Triggers, and Batch processes.

Required Skills & Experience

  • 5+ years of development/testing experience with Salesforce Apex in an enterprise software architecture environment

  • 1+ year of hands-on API integration experience

  • Salesforce certifications are strongly preferred, especially:

  • Salesforce Certified Platform Developer I

  • Salesforce Certified Platform Developer II

  • Practical experience developing and customizing Salesforce using Apex, Visualforce, Triggers, Scheduled and Batch classes

  • Demonstrated experience building Salesforce solutions across one or more of the following:

  • Sales Cloud

  • Service Cloud

  • Marketing Cloud

  • Salesforce Communities/Knowledge

  • Experience integrating Salesforce with external applications using REST, SOAP APIs, OAuth, and Single Sign-On (SSO)

  • Solid understanding of the Salesforce deployment process and tools such as ANT, Change Sets, and Force.com IDE

  • Experience with ETL tools

  • Familiarity with Agile methodologies to deliver high-quality business and technical solutions on the Salesforce platform

  • Experience with UI development technologies (preferred but not required), such as:

  • Bootstrap

  • Lightning Design System (LDS)

  • Lightning Components Development

  • AngularJS, jQuery, JavaScript

  • Experience mentoring or training junior developers is a plus

  • Prior experience or understanding of the healthcare industry is a plus

    Additional Information

    • This is a hybrid position and requires the candidate to be onsite in Lansing, MI two days per week

    • Only local candidates within a one-hour commuting radius of Lansing, MI will be considered

    • This role does not support remote-only work

job.title: D365 trainer with SharePoint experience (32662)
job.description:
Our client is seeking a highly experienced D365 Trainer with SharePoint expertise to support a national training and information management initiative. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of Microsoft 365 (D365), SharePoint (on-premise and online), and experience in developing training programs, videos, and instructional content for users across varied departments and time zones.
Mandatory Active SECRET clearance

Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop and deliver training videos and step-by-step guides for users on SharePoint (on-premise) and Defence 365 features.

  • Build and maintain a SharePoint Online Training site with how-to content, videos, and best practices.

  • Conduct training sessions for new Site Owners using training packages and sandbox environments.

  • Collaborate with the Communications (CO) and Information Management (IM) teams to design onboarding/orientation training for new team members.

  • Design and deploy Power Apps for automating team member intake forms and leadership processes.

  • Create an internal Wiki with approval workflows to replace DWAN-only resources on D365.

  • Support users in navigating the Microsoft Tenant environment post-launch.

  • Perform daily web administration for over 1,200 SharePoint sites.

  • Lead biweekly Information Management Working Groups and L1/L2 sessions to distribute updates and training.

  • Host monthly deployed Information Management sessions for field IMOs.

Qualifications:

  • Proven expertise in D365 and SharePoint (Online & On-Premise)

  • Experience in instructional design and e-learning/training video creation

  • Strong experience with Power Apps and workflow automation

  • Comfortable presenting to and training users of varying technical skill levels

  • Ability to manage and administer large-scale SharePoint environments

  • Active SECRET clearance required

job.title: Technical Systems Administrator/Trainer (32661)
job.description:
Job Title: Technical Systems Administrator / Trainer
Location: Irvine, CA (Dupont Drive) – Hybrid (3 days onsite, 2 days remote)
Company: Myticas’s direct client based in Irvine, CA
Duration: 12+ months (possibility of extension)

Top Skills, Experience, and Education Required:

  • 2–4 years of experience with SharePoint, including site creation and administration

  • 2–4 years of professional experience in one or more of the following roles:

  • Functional Systems Administrator

  • Configuration Manager

  • Solution Architect

  • Project Manager

  • Consultant

  • Trainer

  • At least 2 years of experience administering Atlassian products (Confluence or Jira preferred)

  • Strong interpersonal and relationship-building skills

  • Proven ability to communicate effectively and partner with key stakeholders

    Job Summary:

    Our client is seeking a Technical Systems Administrator / Trainer to support the development, management, and daily operations of SharePoint sites and Atlassian tools. This role plays a critical part in enhancing user adoption, building effective training programs, and optimizing system workflows.

    You will provide hands-on support to users, lead training initiatives, and act as a technical liaison across teams to ensure the platforms are being used efficiently and effectively. Your responsibilities will include system administration, process improvement, user onboarding, and cross-functional collaboration to drive tool adoption and process scalability.

    The ideal candidate is experienced in SharePoint and Atlassian products, thrives in a dynamic environment, enjoys solving complex problems, and excels in working with a diverse team.

    Key Responsibilities:

    • Collaborate with Business Technology and Implementation teams to identify customization opportunities and optimize SharePoint usage

    • Build and configure SharePoint sites and folder structures tailored to specific business needs

    • Serve as the primary administrator for SharePoint and Atlassian (Confluence, Jira), ensuring system functionality, content quality, and process alignment

    • Generate and distribute regular and ad hoc reports to measure system performance and KPIs

    • Design and document workflows, processes, and best practices for system usage

    • Translate business requirements into system enhancements and workflow improvements

    • Assess and recommend integration opportunities for additional tools and platforms

    • Work closely with IT to test, implement, and maintain system updates and functionalities

    • Lead special projects, including training development, project management, and system reporting

    • Conduct training sessions and maintain user support documentation

    • Liaise with vendors for technical support and coordinate training resources

    • Promote proper system usage and best practices among team members

    Required Qualifications:

    • 2–4 years of experience building and managing SharePoint sites

    • 2–4 years of professional experience in a systems administration, training, or related role

    • Creative problem-solving skills with a focus on workflow optimization

    • Ability to lead projects, manage deadlines, and balance multiple priorities

    • Strong communication and collaboration skills with the ability to influence stakeholders

    • Demonstrated ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment

    Preferred Qualifications (Nice to Have):

    • 1–2 years of experience administering Atlassian tools (Confluence, Jira)

    • Experience using APIs to build tool integrations (e.g., Slack API, Jira API)

job.title: Senior Business & Program Management Consultant (32660)
job.description:
Senior Business & Program Management Consultant (GxP/Clinical)
Location: Waukegan, IL (3 days onsite)
Company: Myticas's direct client based in North Chicago, IL

MUST Have:
  1. 8-10 years of Senior IT project experience: System Lifecycle (SLC) Expertise.
  2. GXP system experience required - GXP system implementation including custom development and validated systems.
  3. Portfolio / Program management experience.
  4. Clinical Systems
  5. Project financial management, and vendor management expertise.

Description:
Senior Business Management Consultant to manage and drive all aspects of TWO in-flight system development (custom build) and enhancement projects, complete contracting / pre-SLC assessments for new projects, and assess new business capability requests.

Required:
  • 8-10 years of Senior IT project experience: System Lifecycle (SLC) Expertise, Portfolio / Program management experience, project financial management expertise, vendor management expertise.
  • Must have the ability to create / review SLC documents
  • Track record of successful GXP system implementation including custom development and validated systems.
  • GXP system experience required,
  • Clinical experience strongly preferred
  • Methodology used: Waterfall and Agile

job.title: Drupal Developer (32659)
job.description:
The recruitment team at Myticas Consulting is looking for an experienced Drupal Developer who would be interested in a long-term remote contract opportunity offered within Canada (originally headquartered in Ottawa, ON).

Previous experience required:

  • Experience building web applications in the Drupal (7) CMS
  • Understands key server-side web development concepts through experiences such as:
  • Interpreting graphic visual or interaction designs in HTML, CSS and Javascript.
  • Creating visually appealing web pages or interfaces.
  • Creating, editing or modifying templates for a CMS or web development framework.
  • Programming interaction with JavaScript and/or a lipary such as jQuery, YUI or Prototype.
  • Testing cross-powser, cross-platform, and/or cross-device compatibility for inconsistencies.
  • Testing for compliance to specified standards such as accessibility standards (WCAG 2.0) in the clients region or domain.
  • Conducting observational user testing, or reviewing designs against usability heuristics.
  • Domain specific knowledge or transferable skills
  • Experience with web development languages of HTML, CSS and JavaScript/jQuery.
  • HTML
    • Familiarity of HTML syntax for multiple specifications, including HTML 5.
    • Knowledge of the semantic meaning of all HTML elements.
    • Familiarity with the semantic markup for display of lists, tabular data, forms, articles, etc.
    • Knowledge of markup used for layout such as dividers.
    • Knowledge at the level to be able to hand-code markup.
    • Including media and images.
  • PHP
    • Familiarity with modifying Drupal Theme hooks to display data
    • Understanding how to utilize PHP to filter, process and output html, json, xml
  • CSS
    • Specifying different CSS for various media, devices and displays.
    • Best practices in CSS file organization and structure.
    • Methods for including CSS inline, internal and external via linked style sheets.
    • How to define, combine and group CSS selectors for HTML elements, ID, classes, pseudo classes, child or sibling.
    • Syntax of CSS declarations, properties and attributes.
    • CSS box model and methods for CSS positioning, absolute and relative.
    • Knowledge of properties and attributes to control the display.
    • Familiarity with differences in CSS 2 and CSS 3.
    • Proficient with a CSS Preprocessor such as Sass or LESS.
  • Best practices
    • Drupal standards and modules
    • Methods to ensure powser & device compatibility
    • Methods for degrading gracefully for older powsers and displays.
    • Methods to ensure accessibility.
    • File compression techniques for improving speed.
  • JavaScript
    • Knowledge of the operators, variables, datatypes, objects, properties and methods.
    • Familiarity with control structures such as objects, functions, conditional statements, arrays, loops and expressions.
    • Forms and regular expression validation and submitting data.
    • Knowledge of how to apply logical operators and conditional statements.
    • Knowledge of the DOM HTML objects and their properties.
    • Event handling.
    • Creating and controlling windows and dialogs.
    • Processes for troubleshooting and debugging
    • Familiarity with development and debugging tools for cross-powser issues.
  • jQuery
    • Knowledge of how to employ the jQuery lipary for visual effects, event handling, and document manipulation.

job.title: Technical Manager, Professional Services (32658)
job.description:
Our client is seeking a hands-on Technical Manager to lead the design, development, and delivery of custom technical solutions across their entire product suite. This role blends technical leadership with project execution, guiding engineers and workflow developers through the successful implementation of enterprise-grade media workflows, systems integrations, and cloud-based solutions.

The ideal candidate will have deep technical expertise in cloud infrastructure, software integration, scripting, and solution architecture. They are passionate about translating customer needs into scalable, high-impact solutions while driving engineering excellence through mentorship, best practices, and cross-functional collaboration.

Core Responsibilities

  • Translate customer requirements into actionable technical tasks.

  • Contribute to writing and reviewing Statements of Work (SOW) by providing technical task breakdowns and time estimates.

  • Collaborate with the Commercial Lead to align on project scope, milestones, and sprint planning.

  • Define technical architecture and approaches for workflow implementation.

  • Allocate technical resources and prioritize tasks based on sprint goals.

  • Work with Engineering and DevOps teams to ensure infrastructure, integration, and deployment requirements are met.

  • Review and approve code, enforcing coding standards and best practices.

  • Ensure all technical deliverables meet customer expectations and internal quality standards.

  • Promote best practices in software development and workflow automation.

  • Mentor engineers to foster professional growth and technical excellence.

  • Proactively identify opportunities to improve customer deployments by recommending complementary solutions.

  • Analyze existing customer setups to identify inefficiencies and propose optimizations using the broader product suite.

  • Serve as a technical advisor, helping customers align their needs with the capabilities of our client's platform.

Required Qualifications and Skills

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related field (or equivalent experience).

  • 3+ years of experience in software development or solution engineering.

  • 2+ years of experience in technical leadership or a senior engineering role.

  • Proficiency in object-oriented design, API development, scripting (e.g., Python, Bash), and cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP).

  • Familiarity with workflow automation tools and version control systems.

job.title: Technical Manager, Customer Support (32657)
job.description:
Our client is seeking a highly motivated and experienced Technical Support Manager to lead a team
of talented Technical Support Engineers responsible for providing world-class customer support.

This individual will be accountable for managing daily support operations, coaching and
mentoring team members, driving operational excellence, and building a customer-first culture
that ensures exceptional satisfaction, retention, and long-term success. The ideal candidate will
bring a deep understanding of technical support operations, a background in networking or SaaS
platforms, and a passion for solving customer problems with empathy and urgency.
Core Responsibilities
• Lead and inspire a team of Technical Support Engineers to drive product knowledge, support
excellence, and professional development.
• Manage the day-to-day operations of the support organization, ensuring key performance
indicators such as customer satisfaction, response times, and ticket resolution rates are
consistently met or exceeded.
• Act as the primary point of contact for customer technical escalations, ensuring timely and
effective resolution of complex or high-priority issues.
• Analyze team metrics, SLAs, and customer support trends to implement scalable strategies that
improve response quality and operational efficiency.
• Proactively research and adopt new support tools and technologies that enhance team productivity
and service quality.
• Support career growth and retention through coaching, mentoring, and continuous learning
opportunities.
• Promote and enforce best practices, process improvements, and documentation standards
across the team.
• Collaborate cross-functionally with Product, Engineering, and Customer Success to escalate
systemic issues and prioritize long-term fixes.
• Lead customer-facing support reviews and QBRs, ensuring open communication around issue
trends, resolution plans, and areas of improvement.
• Translate technical feedback and customer pain points into actionable product or
documentation enhancements.
Required Qualifications and Skills
• 7+ years of relevant experience in technical support or customer success roles, including
experience managing escalations.
• Demonstrated success leading support teams in fast-paced, high-growth environments.
• Strong analytical, organizational, and problem-solving skills.
• Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities, with the capacity to engage both technical
and non-technical audiences.
• Solid understanding of networking concepts and tools used in network troubleshooting.
• Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related technical discipline (or equivalent
experience).
• Ability to manage multiple priorities and deadlines in a high-pressure environment.
• Proven track record of proactively identifying risks and implementing mitigation strategies.

job.title: Workflow Application Engineer (32655)
job.description:
We are seeking a Workflow Applications Engineer. This role bridges engineering and operations, requiring technical expertise, strong problem-solving skills, and a passion for continuous learning. You will design, develop, and implement efficient, automated workflows across a variety o

We are seeking a Workflow Applications Engineer. This role bridges engineering and operations, requiring technical expertise, strong problem-solving skills, and a passion for continuous learning. You will design, develop, and implement efficient, automated workflows across a variety of platforms and applications, ensuring smooth integration, optimized performance, and high customer satisfaction.

Essential Functions

  • Design and implement automated workflows tailored to customer requirements.
  • Develop and deliver reliable, scalable solutions using object-oriented principles and API integrations.
  • Program using proprietary tools based on Java and other scripting languages (e.g., Python, Bash).
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams including software engineering, product, and customer service to gather requirements and identify automation opportunities.
  • Ensure seamless integration across cloud and on-premise systems and applications.
  • Monitor application performance for availability and troubleshoot workflow issues as needed.
  • Clearly communicate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Maintain comprehensive documentation of workflows, codebases, and technical solutions.
  • Manage multiple concurrent projects, tasks, and requests in a dynamic environment.

Requirements
Required Qualifications and Skills

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Software Engineering, or equivalent experience.
  • Strong grasp of object-oriented programming and coding fundamentals.
  • Hands-on experience with APIs, integrations, scripting, and command-line tools in Linux/Unix environments.
  • Proficient in Java or scripting languages such as Python or Bash.
  • Experience working with XML and JSON data formats.
  • Excellent debugging, testing, and troubleshooting capabilities.
  • Effective written and verbal communication skills.
  • Familiarity with workflow automation tools and platforms.
  • Proven ability to work both independently and collaboratively.
  • Strong organizational skills and attention to detail in multitasking environments.

Preferred Experience

  • Knowledge of cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or GCP and related virtualization strategies.
  • Experience with databases such as PostgreSQL and Elasticsearch.
  • Background in technical support, solution architecture, or project management.
  • Familiarity with Agile methodologies or startup environments.
  • Experience in the media, entertainment, publishing, or digital media sectors.

Additional Requirements

  • Availability for occasional work during weekends, nights, or early mornings.
  • Strong interpersonal skills with a customer-focused mindset.
  • Enthusiasm for continuous learning and adapting to emerging technologies.

  • Excellent debugging, testing, and troubleshooting capabilities.

job.title: Senior AWS Cloud Project Manager (32652)
job.description:
Job Title: Sr AWS Cloud Project Manager
Location: Waukegan, IL (3 days onsite)
Company: Myticas's direct client based in North Chicago, IL

Duration: 5+ months (with a possibility of extension)

TOP Skills:
  1. 5-10 years of experience of technical project management.
  2. Ability to lead cross-functional teams and manage multiple stakeholders effectively.
  3. Experience with cloud platforms, especially AWS.
  4. Experience managing SDLC projects.

Primary Function:
Develop, execute, and manage multiple IT projects within their defined scope(s). Manage a multitude of interrelated project activities and lead all aspects of the project lifecycle, working with project sponsors/key stakeholders, team members, and management to oversee all phases of project completion. Build and manage project’s work breakdown structure, milestones, risks, issues, and deliverables within the constraints of human and financial resources and changing priorities to ensure the successful completion of the project. Ensure transparent reporting of project status, issues, risks, and financials.

Key Responsibilities:
  • Initiate and Plan Project:
    • Collaborate with business and IT management to establish project goals, objectives, financials, and deliverables.
    • Build and manage the project plan, resources, and Gantt charts to accomplish the project scope.
  • Project Control and Quality Management:
    • Evaluate scope changes, issues, and risks, working with stakeholders to resolve them.
    • Measure performance against the original plan and budget, ensuring compliance with corporate and functional policies and procedures.
    • Maintain and update the RAID log to track project risks, actions, and issues.
  • Execute and Close Project:
    • Develop and execute work plans, securing authorized resources to complete all activities.
    • Lead the team in delivering the project scope, gather lessons learned, and obtain final project approval.
    • Assist in managing the process to ensure all validation deliverables are completed.
  • Project Communication:
    • Produce and distribute project reports to provide accurate status and decision support to stakeholders.
    • Make recommendations to resolve issues and manage risks based on the current project status.
  • Resource and Team Management:
    • Coordinate and assign resources to ensure project needs are met, effectively assign tasks based on team members’ abilities.
    • Motivate the project team to achieve desired outcomes.
  • Decisions and Financial Control:
    • Make decisions impacting project-level activities; influence or have authority over the project budget.
    • Develop and manage a financial plan, maintaining spend within +/- 10% of the overall budget.
    • Track and update financials in Clarity, coordinating estimates and invoices with vendors.
  • Vendor Coordination:
    • Coordinate vendor activities and ensure timely milestone delivery.
    • Ensure vendor purchase orders (POs) are processed promptly.
  • Project Meetings:
    • Facilitate Project Management meetings to oversee execution activities with IT System Owner and Principal Business Systems Consultant.

Qualifications:
  • Bachelor’s degree in business, Information Systems/Computer Science or related discipline.
  • Proven Microsoft Project, PowerPoint, Excel, and Word skills are required.
  • 5-10 years of experience in Information Technology project management.
  • Proven experience with cloud platforms, especially AWS, experience with on-premise HPC clusters, and familiarity with data management tools and best practices a must
  • Experience managing SDLC projects.
  • Flexibility needed while collaborating with the global project team and vendors (eg 7 AM meetings and /or 4 pm meetings).

Preferred Qualifications:
  • PMP Certification
  • PPM Tool experience
  • Pharmaceutical experience
  • Experience managing projects to deliver or enhance validated systems.

Key Stakeholders:
  • Business and Technology resources; varying levels of leadership.

job.description:

job.title: RF Systems Engineer (32648)
job.description:
As a RF Systems Engineer, you’ll be responsible for simulating and modeling the terrestrial and in-orbit communication systems for Lightspeed and support the definition of the architecture.

Main Responsibilities

  • Simulate and model communication systems
  • Work with system architects, RF engineers, antenna engineers, User Terminal and Landing Station engineers, to partition functions between hardware and software domains
  • Model RF link performance and manage link budgets accounting for impairments through the different elements in the system
  • Derive specifications for RF links and RF and antenna subsystems
  • Characterize and analyze system performance. Develop and maintain performance budgets
  • Provide technical support to regulatory, coordination, and market access teams

Education & Experience Required

  • Bachelor's degree in electrical engineering with emphasis in RF/microwave circuits or communication theory
  • At least 5 years of relevant experience RF communication systems
  • Knowledge of digital communication systems, spread spectrum, single and multi-carrier techniques, modulation types such as PSK, APSK, QAM
  • Specific experience with modulation standard such as DVB-S2X and DVB-RCS2, as well as with Adaptive Coding and Modulation (ACM) methods
  • Good experience in MATLAB or other tools for modeling and analyzing RF communication systems

Specialized Knowledge, Skills & Abilities

  • Experience performing analysis and simulation of communication systems
  • Thorough understanding of RF passive and active components
  • Good understanding of active antenna beam forming technologies including digital beam forming, and fast beam hopping
  • Experience characterizing radio performance at microwave frequencies, including rain fade and its effects on the communication links
  • Knowledge of RF transceiver architectures and digital communication theor

job.title: Senior Manager, Radio System Engineering (32647)
job.description:
As the Senior Manager of Radio System Engineering, you will lead all technical aspects of radio system architecture, including air interface definition, concept of operations, functional specifications, and physical implementation of RF functions.

Main Responsibilities:

  • Provide expert-level leadership in RF system development, including trade-offs involving ACP, PAR, out-of-band emissions, pass-band ripple, group delay, and more.

  • Support the finalization of radio system implementation involving agile multi-beam phased array antennas and beam hopping technology.

  • Define operational concepts for all phases of the system lifecycle such as user terminal commissioning, network entry, satellite handovers, time synchronization, and adaptive coding and modulation (ACM).

  • Act as the principal architect for defining air interfaces between user terminals, ground infrastructure, and satellite payloads.

  • Collaborate with RF, antenna, system, and terminal engineers to partition functionality between hardware and software components.

  • Provide input to the system modeling team on design assumptions and strategies for modeling link performance, accounting for impairments across system components.

  • Work closely with the Verification and Test team to ensure thorough validation of requirements and system performance.

  • Participate in relevant industry standards forums (e.g., DVB) and provide strategic recommendations to align internal systems with evolving standards.

Education & Experience – Required:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Electrical, Computer, or Systems Engineering.

  • 15+ years of experience in RF communications systems and/or RF equipment development.

  • Demonstrated experience taking RF systems from concept through iterative design, specification development, and low-rate production.

  • Strong background in system architecture, requirements management, and performance assessment for communication systems.

Education & Experience – Assets:

  • Familiarity with DVB standards such as DVB-S2X and DVB-RCS2.

  • Solid understanding of digital communications, spread spectrum techniques, single and multi-carrier modulation (e.g., PSK, APSK, QAM).

  • Proficiency in MATLAB or equivalent tools for modeling and analyzing RF communication systems.

  • Deep knowledge of RF passive and active components and microwave frequency performance, including the effects of environmental factors such as rain fade.

  • Strong foundation in RF transceiver architecture and digital communication theory.

  • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to effectively engage stakeholders across engineering, management, and external partners.

  • Collaborative, adaptable, and capable of leading multidisciplinary teams in high-performance environments.

job.title: Systems Configuration Identification Specialist (32646)
job.description:
Main Responsibilities

Configuration Identification

  • Support and coordinate activities to establish rules for configuration item (CI) selection and baseline content definition.

  • Assist in selecting configuration items at appropriate levels of the product structure, including determining required configuration documentation for each CI.

Asset and Physical Systems Configuration Management

  • Define, develop, and manage processes, procedures, and tools to identify, document, and control physical assets for a large-scale communications system.

  • Provide support for export control compliance processes such as ITAR.

  • Maintain an inventory of system assets (hardware).

  • Control and document system, hardware, and software configurations, including both "as-designed" and "as-built" baselines.

Software Configuration Management – Release Monitoring

  • Collaborate with technical teams and project management to define roles and responsibilities for configuration and release management.

  • Work with development, test environment, and verification teams to define and document processes for managing software releases.

  • For each release, verify required documentation is complete, approved, and captured, and ensure release packages are created in accordance with established procedures.

  • Confirm that pending or outstanding changes do not impact planned test or release activities.

  • Support development, lab, and test teams to ensure timely and accurate release execution.

  • Assist with impact assessments and update the CI Tree and related configuration documentation to reflect approved changes.

  • Support preparation and execution of configuration item status accounting and configuration audits.

  • Provide subject matter expertise on configuration management (CM) processes, standards, and systems.

  • Contribute to requirements management and traceability process documentation and improvement.

  • Develop training materials for CM identification, software/release management, and general CM procedures.

  • Participate in continuous improvement initiatives to enhance CM process efficiency, reliability, and cost-effectiveness.

Document and Library Management Support

  • Initiate updates to documentation based on approved change requests.

  • Collaborate with document management personnel to track and complete implementation of documentation updates.

  • Ensure all released documents are logged, captured, and statused in the document management system.

  • Act as backup support for document management responsibilities when needed.

Education & Experience – Required

  • Bachelor’s or college degree in engineering, science, or a related field (or equivalent combination of education and experience).

  • 3–6 years of experience in an engineering design environment working with systems, hardware, software, and test teams.

  • 2+ years of experience in configuration and/or data management.

  • 2+ years of experience in release management.

  • Formal training, certification, or experience with CM standards (e.g., CM2, ANSI-EIA 649, ISO 10007).

Education & Experience – Assets

  • Experience with software configuration management tools and processes.

  • Strong verbal and written communication skills with both technical and non-technical audiences.

  • Experience in high-performing, multidisciplinary development teams.

  • Collaborative, team-oriented, and self-driven.

  • Skilled in Microsoft Office at an intermediate level.

  • Bilingual in English and French is an asset (but not required).

job.title: Lab Technician (32645)
job.description:
Myticas direct client is seeking Jr Lab Technician at Waukegan, IL (Hybrid-3 days onsite)

Duration: 6 months (with a possibility of extension)

Description:

One of our direct clients is looking for a Jr Lab Technician who would be responsible for performing highly automated compound management department utilizing robotic instruments to manage the tasks of adding or removing samples from storage banks, along with electronic barcodes to facilitate record-keeping and sample preparation tailored to research scientists’ experimental needs. Automation not only accelerates sample delivery but also promises enhanced consistency of samples regarding concentration accuracy and the uniformity of physical properties across experimental runs. These improvements are crucial in advancing early drug discovery.

Responsibilities:

Work cross-functionally to develop a deep understanding of the scientific processes and identify key bottlenecks that could be improved with automation to increase research velocity.
• Develop appropriate automation protocols to meet the needs research scientists.
• Maintain instrumentation through routine maintenance and Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) to minimize equipment downtime.
• Write and update protocols for new automation workflows using robotic-specific software for laboratory instruments, e.g., Tecan, Beckman Coulter, Agilent Technologies, and SPT.
• Draft, edit, and review laboratory Standard Operating Procedures for the automated platforms and the protocols necessary to support sample delivery.
• Promptly enter all data to support the needs of the research scientist.
• Interpret results, identify anomalies or unexpected outcomes, and provide appropriate remedies.

Qualifications:
List required and preferred qualifications (up to 10). Include education, skills, and experience.
• Bachelor’s degree in a scientific discipline (e.g., biology, chemistry, or similar).
• Experience with robotic liquid handlers from Hamilton, TECAN, Agilent Technologies, or Beckman Coulter.
• Experience in compound management preferred.
• Ability to work upright and stationary and/or standing for typical working hours.
• Ability to lift and move objects up to 25 pounds.
• Ability to work in non-traditional work environments.
• Ability to use and learn standard office equipment and technology proficiently.
• May have exposure to potentially hazardous elements typically found in laboratory environments (PPE required).

job.title: Manufacturing Engineer (32643)
job.description:
Clover Consulting (a Myticas Co.) has a direct client in Grand Rapids, MI in need of a MANUFACTURING ENGINEER - willing to consider all experience levels - this is a contract role to start, with conversion to perm the goal.


Planned 2nd shift hours of 4pm-12pm/1am, to support production.

We are hiring Associate to Sr. Manufacturing Engineer to lead and provide ongoing support through our manufacturing life cycle!

What You Will Be Doing:
With general direction, will lead the introduction of new products into the facility, improve productivity and profitability of existing production procedures, and provide ongoing support through the manufacturing life cycle. Acts as a technical expert in process technology

Improvements: Independently, with innovation and creativity, evaluates manufacturing processes to ensure optimal labor and material costs to increase productivity and profitability. Through justifications and evaluations, identifies prime areas for improvement. Tracks expenditures to ensure outlays are within budgeted amounts. Identifies, reduces, and eliminates worker exposure(s) to ergonomic stress(es) in the work place.

Floor Support: Provides timely product and process support for any manufacturing area to diagnose problems and implement solutions to minimize interruptions to production.

Special Projects: Leads the implementation of significant product, process, or other corporate change initiatives being introduced into the plant.

Strategic/Manufacturing Planning: Provides advanced research to introduce/integrate new processes, equipment, and technologies into the company


Who You Are:
Preferred Skills and Competencies
  • Very strong analysis skills: process, capacity, cost/benefit, waste stream, and quality tools.
  • Internal and external quality support/management
  • Knowledge in lean manufacturing techniques: flow, PQ, equipment reliability, and set up reduction.
  • Facilitation and negotiation skills
  • Knowledge of material handling
  • Productivity improvement techniques: RCI’s
  • Behavior sciences (logic, sociology, etc.)
  • Economics and financial analysis
  • Work measurement
  • Interpersonal skills
  • Computer skills; advanced level required to utilize Excel and Access programs
  • Experience in design, specification, purchase, and installation of new equipment
  • Experience in the Engineering Design Process
  • Knowledge of simulation, process modeling, and value stream mapping
  • Project management and leadership ability
  • Occupational Bio Mechanics/Human Factors Engineering
  • Strategic planning

Required Skills and Competencies
  • 4 year technical degree or equivalent education

job.title: Local to Chicago-Sr Business Systems Analyst (32632)
job.description:
Myticas direct client is seeking Business Systems Analyst with QA experience at Waukegan, IL (Hybrid-3 days onsite)

Duration: 5 months (with a possibility of extension)

Description
The BSA/QA will play a critical role in bridging the gap between business needs and technology solutions. This individual will work closely with the project team and stakeholders to understand their business requirements and do document them in User Stories to then be developed. The BSA/QA will create test cases for user stories and will execute these tests and clearly documenting results and creating defects where needed.

  • Experience in Agile/Scrum Environments on multiple Projects.
  • Experience in developing test plans, strategies, and test Scenarios.
  • Create, execute, and maintain test cases and test scripts. Collaborate with the development team to address and resolve identified issues in a timely manner.

  • Excellent Communication skills-Verbal and written.

job.title: SAP FICO/RTR Lead (32631)

job.title: Senior Design Verification Specialist (32630)

Hybrid, United States

job.title: Lead Custom Analog Layout Engineeer (32628)
job.description:
Our client is seeking a Lead Custom Analog Layout Engineer to support the development of high-performance analog and mixed-signal ICs for next-generation communication and data center systems. In this hybrid U.S.-based role, you'll collaborate closely with circuit designers to ensure optimal layout quality, performance, and delivery timelines.

Responsibilities:
  • Partner with circuit designers to optimize block- and chip-level floorplans.
  • Perform daily layout editing, verification (DRC/LVS), and quality checks using industry-standard tools.
  • Apply best practices and efficient layout methodologies to streamline design cycles.
  • Contribute to chip-level integration, including P&R and top-level planning.
Key Qualifications:
  • Extensive experience using layout tools such as Cadence Virtuoso and/or Laker.
  • Proficiency in DRC/LVS/ERC verification flows (e.g., Calibre, PVS, IC Validator).
  • Solid understanding of layout challenges including IR drop, EM, RC delay, crosstalk, self-heating, and analog matching techniques.
  • Hands-on experience designing layouts for precision analog blocks like SD-ADC, SAR-ADC, bandgaps, and regulators.
  • Familiarity with analog design methodologies and layout constraints.
  • Experience with RC extraction and EM/IR analysis is a plus.
  • Strong communication skills and ability to work effectively with cross-functional, distributed teams.
Education & Experience:
  • Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field or equivalent experience.
  • 10+ years of experience in analog/mixed-signal layout design.
Location:
Hybrid – United States

job.title: Lead Mixed - Signal IC Design Engineer - High -Speed Circuits (32627)

  • Follow established design flows and contribute to process improvements.

  • Strong experience with CAD tools: Cadence Virtuoso, Spectre, Incisive, Calibre, EMX, Totem EM/IR.
  • Proven track record designing and bringing to production high-speed analog/mixed-signal IPs in deep submicron CMOS (e.g., high-speed ADCs, DACs, low-jitter PLLs).
  • In-depth understanding of analog circuit methodologies, layout effects, and device physics.
  • Experience with behavioral modeling (Verilog-A/AMS).
  • Ability to work collaboratively with distributed design teams.
  • Strong problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and effective communication.
  • Experience with Matlab and/or optical communication theory is a plus.

  • M.S. in Electrical Engineering with 12+ years of experience, or
  • Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering with 8+ years of experience.
Location:
Hybrid – United States

job.title: Senior Mixed -Signal ASIC Design Engineer (32626)
job.description:
Our client is seeking a Senior Mixed-Signal ASIC Design Engineer to join a dynamic team working on next-generation integrated circuits for high-performance communication and data center applications.


Responsibilities:
  • Design and simulate high-resolution data converters (DACs/ADCs) and low-power analog circuits such as bandgap references, opamps, and output buffers.
  • Develop layout floorplans, supervise layout activities, and provide clear guidance to layout engineers (hands-on layout work may be required).
  • Create analog test plans and collaborate with product/test engineering teams for characterization and validation.
  • Follow established design methodologies and release processes to ensure product quality and consistency.
  • Model circuit behavior using Verilog-A/AMS for design verification.
Key Qualifications:
  • Strong expertise with analog/mixed-signal design tools (Cadence Virtuoso, Spectre, Layout XL, Mentor AFS, Calibre).
  • Proven experience in taking data converters from design to production.
  • In-depth understanding of CMOS and high-voltage (BCD) design, layout effects, and ESD protection.
  • Skilled in circuit analysis, device physics, and analog design methodology.
  • Excellent communication skills and ability to work effectively in cross-functional, distributed teams.
  • Capable of mentoring junior engineers and independently resolving complex design challenges.

Manage a multitude of interrelated project activities and lead all aspects of the project lifecycle, working with project sponsors/key stakeholders, team members, and management to oversee all phases of project completion. Build and manage project’s work breakdown structure, milestones, risks, issues, and deliverables within the constraints of human and financial resources and changing priorities to ensure the successful completion of the project.   • Lead the team in delivering the project scope, gather lessons learned, and obtain final project approval.

This is a hybrid position requiring both remote and onsite work in Waukegan, IL.

job.title: Senior FPGA Developer (32589)
job.description:
Overview & Role Focus

This role is centered on innovating and advancing state-of-the-art video processing and transport capabilities, delivering high-performance solutions on some of the most integrated poadcast hardware platforms available today. The successful candidate will work hands-on with FPGA design, real-time media interfaces, and poadcast protocol implementation, playing a key role across architecture, development, testing, and cross-functional support.

Key Responsibilities

  • Lead the development and continuous improvement of advanced video transport and processing features within tightly integrated poadcast hardware.
  • Design RTL for real-time, high-throughput media systems involving advanced interfaces—such as PCIe, memory, and specialized hardware acceleration (e.g., video scaling, HDR/SDR conversion).
  • Implement FPGA-based real-time transport protocols like SMPTE 2110 and SDI.
  • Participate in architectural planning: advise on FPGA density, schematic reviews, clocking strategies, and thermal considerations.
  • Build complete IO ring designs across modern FPGAs (Arria10, Stratix-10, Ultrascale+, MPSoC, Agilex) and validate pin-outs/IP within Quartus and Vivado environments.
  • Define and negotiate high-level design specs, assist in part selection, and align with aggressive project timelines.
  • Contribute to design specifications and documentation used by cross-functional teams.
  • Collaborate closely with peers on design verification and testing of FPGA and hardware systems.
  • Tackle debugging with a methodical and efficient approach.
  • Support team members throughout the entire New Product Introduction (NPI) lifecycle—from design through manufacturing to customer support.

Required Skills & Background

  • 5+ years in FPGA and hardware development, with a strong preference for experience in video/audio-centric technologies.
  • Intermediate to senior-level expertise in FPGA architecture and core components.
  • Deep understanding of high-speed serial interfaces, clock domains, timing closure, and transceiver integration.
  • Proficiency in Verilog, SystemVerilog, and TCL scripting; capable of creating testbenches and running simulations (e.g., VCS).
  • Familiarity with modern Intel and Xilinx FPGA families and their development/debugging toolchains.
  • Hands-on experience with interfaces like DDR3/DDR4, HBM, PLLs, and gigabit transceivers.
  • Skilled in lab-based debugging using oscilloscopes, JBERTs, network analyzers, waveform monitors, etc.
  • Embedded system awareness—experience with Linux, C/C++, bash scripting, and networking considered valuable.
  • Broadcast studio domain knowledge is highly desirable, especially within video production and distribution workflows.
  • A strong grasp of digital video/audio standards and signal integrity is considered a plus.
  • Driven and independent, yet collaborative—equally adept at working solo or influencing poader team strategies.
  • Quick learner with a creative mindset and ability to push ideas from concept to market.
  • Comfortable making bold decisions that balance quality, speed, and cost for optimal business outcomes.
  • Effective communicator with sharp observational skills and a problem-solving mindset.

  • Bachelor’s in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience

  • Open to limited travel (2–4 times annually) for team collaboration

PREFERRED EXPERIENCE / NICE TO HAVE
  • Experience with modern .NET (.NET Core / .NET 6+)
  • Familiarity with Microsoft Azure and DevOps tools
  • Understanding of containerization (Docker, Linux containers)
  • Proficiency with RESTful API development
  • Exposure to cloud-based services (Azure preferred, AWS acceptable)
  • Experience with modern front-end frameworks like React, Angular, or Vue.js
  • Knowledge of CI/CD tools such as Azure DevOps, GitHub Actions, or Jenkins
  • Test-driven development (TDD) and experience with testing frameworks (xUnit, MSTest, NUnit, Jest, Mocha)
  • Security/authentication protocols (OAuth2, OpenID Connect, IdentityServer)
  • Event-driven architecture and messaging systems (e.g., RabbitMQ, Azure Service Bus, Kafka)

job.title: Cloud Operations Engineer (32574)
job.description:
Job Title: Cloud Operations Engineer
Location: Vancouver, BC

Qualifications Required

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Cybersecurity, or a related field. Equivalent professional experience will also be considered.

  • A minimum of 7 years of experience in Azure cloud operations, with a strong focus on security and vulnerability management.

  • Proven experience in managing and securing large-scale Azure environments in production settings.

  • Hands-on experience with vulnerability scanning, remediation, and compliance within enterprise cloud infrastructures.

  • Extensive experience in security incident response and threat mitigation in Azure environments.

Technical Skills

Azure Expertise

  • Deep understanding of core Azure services, including:

    • Azure Security Center

    • Microsoft Defender for Cloud

    • Azure Key Vault

    • Azure Policy

    • Azure Sentinel (SIEM)

    • Azure Active Directory (Azure AD)

Security and Vulnerability Tools

  • Proficient in using tools such as Qualys, Tenable Nessus, or Rapid7 for vulnerability scanning and management.

  • Experience with native Azure security tools for threat detection and remediation.

Infrastructure Hardening

  • Strong knowledge of best practices for securing Azure resources such as virtual machines, storage accounts, Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS), and network components.

  • Familiarity with zero-trust architecture principles and their implementation in Azure.

Automation and Scripting

  • Advanced scripting skills using PowerShell, Azure CLI, Python, or other automation tools.

  • Experience in integrating security checks and controls within CI/CD pipelines.

Certifications (Preferred or Mandatory)

Azure Cloud Certifications

  • Microsoft Certified: Azure Administrator Associate (AZ-104)

  • Microsoft Certified: Azure Security Engineer Associate (AZ-500)

  • Microsoft Certified: Cybersecurity Architect Expert (SC-100)

Security Certifications

  • Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP)

  • Certified Ethical Hacker (CEH)

  • CompTIA Security+

  • GIAC certifications (e.g., GCIH, GSEC, GCED)

Other Requirements

  • Familiarity with regulatory and compliance standards such as ISO 27001, SOC 2, GDPR, and HIPAA.

  • Experience conducting or supporting cloud security audits.

  • Demonstrated ability to stay up to date with emerging cloud and cybersecurity technologies and trends.

job.title: IP Network Architect (32569)
job.description:
The Senior IP Network Architect is a Subject Matter Expert (SME) on all aspects of the Network design and works with internal teams and external contractors to ensure designs, implementation decisions, validation plans and documentation reflect the business requirements and objectives of the program.
Networking
  • Lead the design of complex IP network architectures, considering business requirements, scalability, and performance.
  • Possess a strong command of network platforms and appliances, including routers, switches, firewalls, SDWAN controllers, IPSEC VPN gateways, and deep packet inspection tools.
  • In coordination with the Network and System Engineering teams attend, contribute and produce materials for internal and external design and system engineering reviews for Network Engineering related activities.
  • Prepare and deliver materials including presentations, reference documentation and test strategies for network equipment deployment and operation.
  • Develop and oversee plans including product idea investigations, proof of concept, service validation and product demonstrations in lab.
  • Maintain a deep understanding of industry standards and protocols related to segment routing, such as IS-IS, OSPF, BGP, and MPLS.
  • Maintain familiarity with transport network technologies including Segment Routing (SR-MPLS) and Software Defined Networking (SDN).
  • Assess, evaluate, and recommend network platforms and appliances, hardware, and software solutions to meet business requirements.
  • Represent the Network Engineering team by documenting and delivering network requirements to hardware and software development teams specifically in the areas of customer facing MEF 3.0 interface and networking design support requirements.
Security and Compliance
  • Security and Compliance:
  • Design and implement secure network solutions with a focus on firewall configurations, IPSEC VPNs, and deep packet inspection techniques.
  • Ensure compliance with industry standards and best practices for network security.
  • Optimization and Performance:
  • Continuously monitor network performance, analyzing metrics and conducting assessments to identify bottlenecks, vulnerabilities, and areas for improvement. Develop strategies to optimize network performance, enhance security, and ensure high availability.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to enhance network performance and reliability.
  • Experience with network automation and scripting using tools such as Python, Ansible, or similar.
  • Emerging Technologies:
  • Stay current with industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices related to IP networking and network appliances.
  • Proactively recommend and lead the adoption of new technologies that align with business goals.
Vendor Management
  • Collaborate with vendors to evaluate products, negotiate contracts, and ensure the successful deployment and operation of network appliances.
  • Technical Leadership:
  • Provide mentorship and guidance to junior network engineers, sharing your expertise and promoting professional growth.
  • Troubleshooting and Support:
  • Lead in-depth troubleshooting and root cause analysis of network issues, providing timely and effective resolutions.
Education & Experience
  • Bachelor's degree in computer science, Information Technology, or a related field or equivalent work experience.
  • 10+ years of progressive experience in designing and architecting IP networks, with a focus on routing, firewalls, SDWAN, IPSEC VPNs, and deep packet inspection.
  • Understanding of Metro Ethernet Forum (MEF) standards and objectives as they relate to Carrier Ethernet Services.
  • Professional certifications such as CCIE, CCNP, CISSP or equivalent are highly desirable.
  • Expertise in network appliance evaluation, selection, and integration.
  • In-depth understanding of security principles and practices as they relate to network architecture.
  • Proven experience with network troubleshooting, performance optimization, and security enhancement.
  • Strong knowledge of industry-leading routing protocols, firewall technologies, SDWAN solutions, IPSEC VPNs, and deep packet inspection methods.
  • Experience with network automation and scripting using tools such as Python, Ansible, or similar.
  • Leadership experience and the ability to mentor junior team members.
  • Excellent communication (verbal, written, presentation) and interpersonal skills.
  • Comfortable leading meetings and able to communicate issues and trends to senior management and other groups at the appropriate level of detail.
  • Communicates well with own team and across organizational boundaries to ensure the successful completion of shared goals.
Working Conditions
  • Working conditions are generally comfortable typical of an office environment with occasional work within Data Centres.
  • Occasional international travel is anticipated.

job.title: Senior IT Project Manager (32567)
job.description:
Senior Project Manager (Contract)


Overview:

We are seeking an experienced Senior Project Manager to support the execution of multiple strategic initiatives within our client’s organization. This role is critical in ensuring the successful delivery of projects in alignment with business objectives, IT leadership direction, and established PMO frameworks.


Key Responsibilities:


As a Senior PM, you will work closely with business and technical stakeholders to steer initiatives from planning through to implementation, ensuring delivery is on time, within scope, and on budget. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
  • Project Planning & Scope Management:
    Define project scope and objectives in collaboration with sponsors and stakeholders. Develop detailed project schedules and comprehensive plans covering scope, timeline, budget, risk, change, communication, and quality management.
  • Execution & Oversight:
    Monitor project progress, manage cross-functional resources, and lead project execution according to established goals. Ensure effective team collaboration and resource alignment across all phases.
  • Risk & Issue Management:
    Identify, assess, and manage project risks and critical path dependencies. Escalate and resolve issues while maintaining transparency and governance.
  • Stakeholder Engagement & Reporting:
    Prepare and deliver executive-level updates, dashboards, and steering presentations. Facilitate workshops and status meetings; ensure stakeholder expectations are managed effectively throughout the project lifecycle.
  • Change Management Integration:
    Align with change management strategies to support adoption and ensure smooth transition of initiatives. Track implementation and address any business readiness concerns.
  • Governance & Quality Control:
    Ensure adherence to organizational PMO standards and best practices. Support continuous improvement efforts and implement lessons learned.
  • Business Case Support:
    Partner with business units and analysts to develop compelling business cases for project investment and benefits realization.


Qualifications & Skills:

We’re looking for candidates who bring both strategic foresight and executional discipline, with the following profile:
  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Business, IT Management, or a related discipline.
  • PMP certification (or equivalent experience) is required.
  • 8–10 years of project management experience, with at least 5 years managing large-scale initiatives.
  • Proficient in project planning tools and methodologies.
  • Adept at managing matrixed teams and external vendors.
  • Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
  • Strong problem-solving capabilities and ability to navigate ambiguity.
  • Demonstrated ability to juggle multiple priorities while maintaining a focus on delivery and results.

job.title: Digital Marketing Consultant (32563)
job.description:
Clover Consulting has a direct client in Grand Rapids, MI in need of a Digital Marketing Consulting to support Search Engine Optimization activities. This is an ON-SITE role starting as a 5 months contract, with likely extensions. Candidates local to the Grand Rapids area, are preferred. Qualified candidates please provide resume. Thank you!
Job Description (Visible to Supplier): Digital Marketing Contractor – Job Responsibilities

In response to evolving digital marketing priorities and the growing importance of AI in search, we are expanding the role of our current SEO lead and seeking a Digital Marketing Contractor to provide support for core SEO responsibilities. This role will help ensure continuity in execution and performance monitoring while allowing the team to focus on broader strategic initiatives. The contractor will support global SEO operations and partner with market teams to enhance visibility, discoverability, and performance across digital properties.

Duration: July – December 2025, with potential extension
Location: Grand Rapids, MI (Onsite)
Reports to: Global SEO Lead

Key Responsibilities

Operational SEO Execution
• Conduct keyword research to support market-level needs and content planning.
• Perform technical SEO audits using tools like Ahrefs and Google Search Console.
• Support content optimization efforts, including metadata, on-page structure, and internal linking.
• Compile and deliver monthly SEO performance reports using platforms such as Ahrefs, Heap, and GSC.
• Troubleshoot SEO issues reported by markets and provide actionable solutions.
• Leverage AI tools and approaches to generate recommendations for content optimization, keyword discovery, link-building, and landing page refinement.
• Integrate AI-enabled tools to automate repetitive SEO tasks and improve execution speed and scalability.

SEO Training and Enablement
• Assist in delivering SEO onboarding sessions and office hours for market teams.
• Help maintain and update SEO playbooks, best practices, and documentation on SharePoint.
• Create or revise modular self-serve resources to enable independent market optimization.
• Support the creation and management of a centralized SharePoint hub for training.

Performance Monitoring and Insights
• Support organic search sentiment analysis and reputation tracking.
• Monitor and extract insights from dashboards (Heap, Ahrefs) to identify trends and risks.
• Assist in evaluating SEO impact for major product launches and post-launch performance reviews.
• Apply AI-powered tools to surface deeper insights from large-scale performance data.

Collaboration and Coordination
• Work cross-functionally with content, analytics, and technical teams to integrate SEO best practices.
• Participate in global team meetings or planning sessions to ensure SEO considerations are included.
• Escalate technical SEO issues or strategic risks to the Global SEO Lead.

Tool and Vendor Support
• Assist with user access management, licensing coordination, and onboarding for SEO tools.
• Support evaluations of SEO tool usage and effectiveness.
• Coordinate with vendors to troubleshoot issues or implement platform improvements.

?

Qualifications
• 5+ years of experience in digital marketing and hands-on SEO in global or multi-market settings.
• Proficiency with SEO tools like Heap, Ahrefs, Google Search Console, and Lumar (or equivalent).
• Strong analytical skills; able to turn performance data into clear, actionable insights.
• Excellent writing and editing skills, with an understanding of search-optimized content.
• Demonstrated experience creating or reviewing metadata, headers, and on-page copy for SEO.
• Familiarity with CMS platforms and technical SEO concepts (indexing, crawling, Core Web Vitals).
• Strong understanding of how AI can be applied to SEO (e.g., prompt engineering, content summarization, automated content audits, keyword clustering).
• Experience working with cross-functional teams across content, marketing, and tech.
• Ability to work independently, manage multiple priorities, and adapt in a fast-paced environment.
